title: Professor the Hon. Gareth Evans, AC, KC | The Simons Foundation

quotes: Distinguished Honorary Professor at the Australian National University, where he was Chancellor from 2010-19
"Australia must lobby US for ‘no first use’ of nuclear weapons, says ex-minister Gareth Evans" - The Guardian, October 31 2023
"Revitalizing the Struggle for Human Rights" - Project Syndicate, December 9 2022
"UK Abdicates its Global Responsibility in Nuclear Weapons Surge" - Asia-Pacific Leadership Network (APLN) Statement, March 19 2021
"How to achieve a nuclear-weapons-free world." - #wethepeoples2020 event for the International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons, Jan 26 2021
“Australia in the world: it’s time to punch our weight” - 2018 Tom Uren Memorial Lecture - Sydney, December 2 2018
“Reflections of a frustrated nuclear disarmer” - dinner address to the “Korean Peninsula in Crisis: What can Australia do?” Policy Forum - Canberra, 26 March 2018
“Reflections of an Incorrigible Optimist” - address to The Illawarra Connection - Wollongong, April 10, 2018

The Simons Foundation is a charitable organization in Vancouver, Canada, with a focus on education on nuclear disarmament, international law and human security.
